title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Les Compotes et Marmelades [Compotes and Marmalade], for the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]", 1819–20
title_raw: Plate Design:  Les Compotes et Marmelades [Compotes and Marmalade], for the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache, graphite on cream laid paper, circular border in pen and brown ink
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink upper right:  Les compotes et marmelades [The compotes and marmalade]; left:  Des cuisinieres sont/occupees a pelerer et a couper/des pommes et des poires, pour/compotes et marmelades, une/autre femme, les appritent [word crossed out]/pour etre servies; au fond on/les cuit-. petit garcon-demande/une poire qu'on lui refuse [The cooks are/busy peeling and cutting/apples and pears for/compotes and marmalades, an/other woman prepares them/for serving.  In the rear/they are cooked--a little boy-asks/ for a pear which he is refused]; right:  ne pas oublier/de place le/sucre quelque/part/elairé en/dessin [don't forget to place the sugar somewhere/made clear in the drawing]
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer Samuels, New York
dimensions: 14.7 x 20.7 cm (5 13/16 x 8 1/8 in. ), at widest point
description: Scene in a kitchen.  A cook, right middleground, cuts fruit into a large bowl while a woman, seated at right, assists her. A young boy,center middleground, picks up a pear with his right hand.   Another woman, left middleground, spoons some marmalade onto a plate held by a small boy,while a cook, right rearground, stirs the compote over a wood stove.  A servant/waiter carrying a tray ascends the stairs in the left rearground.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Les Compotes et Marmelades [Compotes and Marmalade], for the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]", 1819–20. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache, graphite on cream laid paper, circular border in pen and brown ink. 1989-13-19.
